Trial_Design.evidence: All surgical patients requiring NTI were randomly allocated into two groups (n = 53 each)

Intervention.evidence: Group C, using the conventional intubation technique, and Group I, using the cuff inflation-deflation technique

Method_Outcome.evidence: Intubation time, types of maneuvers, number of maneuvers, hemodynamic response, percentage of glottic opening (POGO) score, and complications were evaluated

Result_Outcome.evidence: The cuff inflation technique required significantly less time for successful NTI compared to the conventional group (27.86 ± 4.47 s vs. 41.11 ± 10.98 s, respectively; P < 0.0001)
